duck: Composing stick - Composing sticks were manufactured by many companies, but notably by the H.B. Rouse company.

Justification (typesetting) - In typesetting, justification (sometimes referred to as 'full justification') is the typographic alignment setting of text or images within a column or "measure" to align along both the left and...
Dingbat - A dingbat is an ornament, character or spacer used in typesetting, sometimes more formally known as a printer's ornament or printer's character.
typesetting definition: the process of setting material in type or into a form to be used in printing.
Hot metal typesetting - In printing and typography, hot metal typesetting refers to 19th-century technologies for typesetting text in letterpress printing.
Typesetting is the composition of text by means of types.
Formatted text - Formatted text, styled text or rich text, as opposed to plain text, has styling information beyond the minimum of semantic elements: colours, styles, sizes and special features.

 Sciences|Cyclopaedia]].]] .]] 'Typesetting' is the composition of text by means
 of types.<ref name="typesetting random house dictionary
 definition">Dictionary.com Unabridged. Random House, Inc. 23 December 2009.
 [http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/typeset Dictionary.reference.com]</ref>

Typesetting requires the prior process of designing a font and storing it in
some manner. Typesetting is the retrieval of the stored letters (called sorts in
mechanical systems and glyphs in digital systems) and the ordering of them
according to a language's orthography for visual display.
wiki.title: typesetting
